column4: Hi all. i have a problem, i just installed Ubuntu 8.04, all was ok, and rebooted PC, now i get "run COMMAND with root directory set to NEWROOT" and can't run it, can someone help?
can you log on ok? does this message stop you from logging on? if so, where are you seeing it?
i boot up pc, there is a loading screen and after 3 sec i get this
so this is before you enter your username and password?
yes
and that is the exact error message you get?
yes i see only this
i would reinstall grub if i were you.
ok, i will try this, thx
i get a "find: /boot/grub: No such file or directory" when i use ""find /boot/grub/stage1" at grub, any idea?
where are you now? within the live CD?
did you mount your linux partitions?
i installed in on same partiyion as windows
eh? you mean you installed linux on an ntfs partition?
yes, its bad?
yes indeed, grub does not know how to read off of ntfs partitions to get the boot images
i jusy used the option that was in the installation, so what can i do now>
the best thing to do is create a new partition with gparted, and install linux on that one
ok, i will try, i have also a qurstion, how yo uninstall that one from the ntfs partition, the wondows installer cant do it
you'll probably need to boot up into windows and delete all the linux directories from C: (or the drive letter your windows install uses)
ok, thanks for your help
